result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan S Lake

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan S Lake not in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Ryan S Lake. 
Prosecuting attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
2022CF000053, 2022TR000293, 2022TR000294, 2022TR000295, 2022TR000296 & 22CF30 tracking together:
Atty Frank has no record of where is client is.  Atty Lippert requests a warrant but has no objection to stay the warrant for a week.
Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear in 22CF53 as well.
Atty Frank asks for a stay for 1 week.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue in both cases.

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan S Lake appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone for Ryan S Lake. 
2022CF000030, 2022TR000293, 2022TR000294, 2022TR000295, 2022TR000296 & 22CF53 tracking together:
Atty Frank states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Frank states that the defendant will waive time limits for the Prelim. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Not Guilty pleas will be entered on the Traffic matters.
Set status
bond continued

Court questions 22CF30 because that has a special prosecutor on it.  
Atty Frank asks for a status be set.
BY THE COURT:  Court will set at the same time as the other cases; parties are to reach out to Atty Lippert's office.
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

2:41 PM Defendant Ryan S Lake appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Court is recording the hearing by Zoom.
Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.
2:46pm  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz will be appointing Atty Frank on the case but will appear today for bail.  

 Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Juech states that the Dane County case started with a warrant so it wasn't something that he missed.
Atty Gumz responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
